explanation: The outer condition `if b==a+1:` was incorrect because when b==a+1 but a%3==0 (for example 3 4) the inner `if a%3!=0:` is false and there is no corresponding else, so the program produced no output. I fixed that by combining the checks into the outer if: `if b==a+1 and a%3!=0:` so that the outer else will handle the b==a+1 but a%3==0 case and print 'No'. This follows the pattern of combining conditions seen in the retrieved diffs (e.g., combining checks like B-A==1 with an additional constraint).
